meanings.definition: A person who rides horses in races.
meanings.sent1: The jockey won the horse race with great speed.
meanings.sent2: The jockey rode the horse to victory at the racetrack.
meanings.sent3: The jockey and the horse make a winning team on the track.
meanings.sent4: The jockey skillfully guided the horse like a conductor leading an orchestra.
meanings.sent5: The jockey's colorful uniform stood out as they raced towards the finish line.

meanings.definition: To maneuver or manipulate in a skillful manner.
meanings.sent1: She had to jockey the car into a tight parking spot.
meanings.sent2: He tried to jockey the pieces into position on the chessboard.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to jockey the pots and pans to fit them all on the stove.
meanings.sent4: The politician tried to jockey his way into a position of power.
meanings.sent5: The gymnast had to jockey her body to perform the perfect routine.
